pr_title: APPSERV-20 Add Config Source for Payara Variables

timeline.message: APPSERV-20 refactor big method in TranslatedConfigView and translate values returned from password alias config provider
APPSERV-20 Add new alias config source
APPSERV-20 Add unit test and correct syntax
APPSERV-20 Use correct properties store and add copyright
APPSERV-20 Undo refactor in TranslatedConfigView since it breaks recursion and add tests for recursion

Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/payara/Payara into APPSERV-20

 Conflicts:
	nucleus/payara-modules/nucleus-microprofile/config-service/src/main/java/fish/payara/nucleus/microprofile/config/spi/ConfigProviderResolverImpl.java

timeline.author: jbee

replies.bodyText:
Yes, it lets you see what the page actually returns without using a debugger. It also means it prints it on the terminal running the test rather than in the server log.
Or are you referring specifically to print vs. println?
replies.author: Pandrex247

replies.bodyText: Just wanted make sure this is intentionally present.
replies.author: jbee

timeline.bodyText: I'd like to see a message in connection with assertTrue and contains. Maybe its a good idea to create a little helper method that in case of failure has a message like "Expected contains: Normal Notation: wobbles" and so forth.
timeline.author: jbee

timeline.bodyText: Can't see a caller for this method.
timeline.author: jbee

replies.bodyText: Yep, left behind from a refactor. Thanks :)
replies.author: Pandrex247

timeline.bodyText: Collections.emptyList() is suggested to be preferred over using Collections.EMPTY_LIST directly.
timeline.author: jbee

replies.bodyText: Was copied from another method. I'll make the change there too
replies.author: Pandrex247

+package fish.payara.nucleus.microprofile.config.source;
+
+import org.eclipse.microprofile.config.spi.ConfigSource;
+import org.glassfish.config.support.TranslatedConfigView;
+
+import java.util.HashMap;
+import java.util.Map;
+import java.util.Properties;
+
+/**
+ * Config source for the microprofile-config-alias.properties file. This config source runs properties through the
+ * TranslatedConfigView class to perform substitutions on aliases, system properties, and environment variables.
+ *
+ * @author Andrew Pielage <andrew.pielage@payara.fish>
+ */
+public class AliasPropertiesConfigSource extends PayaraConfigSource implements ConfigSource {
+
+    private final Properties properties;
+
+    public AliasPropertiesConfigSource(Properties properties) {
+        super();
+        this.properties = properties;
+    }
+
+    @Override
+    public int getOrdinal() {
+        return Integer.parseInt(configService.getMPConfig().getAliasPropertiesOrdinality());
+    }
+
+    @Override
+    public Map<String, String> getProperties() {
+        HashMap<String,String> result = new HashMap<>(properties.size());
+
+        for (Object key : properties.keySet()) {
+            String alias = properties.getProperty((String) key);
+            String value = getValue((String) key);

timeline.bodyText: I wonder why PropertiesConfigSource gets the appName passed while AliasPropertiesConfigSource does not.
timeline.author: jbee

replies.bodyText:
It's not actually used in either, but I left the original alone originally as I thought I might have missed something.
On second look though I can't see anything that uses it since it's private scoped with no getter - I'll remove it
replies.author: Pandrex247

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' of github.com:payara/Payara into APPSERV-20
APPSERV-20 Review comments and rename file and config source
